Sentencas: Perovskite type SrCo0.9Ta0.1O3-delta (SCT91) cathode exhibits high activity for oxygen reduction reactions, but the instability in Cr-containing atmosphere restricts its application in intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, a B-site medium-entropy SrCo0.5Fe0.2Ti0.1Ta0.1Nb0.1O3-delta (SCFTTN52111) cathode is proposed and investigated as a potential Cr-tolerance cathode.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical activity of pristine SCT91
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: cathode degrades rapidly in the presence of volatile chromium species.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In contrast, SCFTTN52111 performs very stable.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Chromium vapors prefer to react with segregated SrO species rather than Co3O4 precipitates.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Significant secondary phases of SrCrO4 and Co3O4 are detected on SCT91 electrode, while only trace by-products are found on medium-entropy cathode.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The better Cr tolerance is closely related to the enhanced structural stability by medium-entropy engineering and reduced surface Sr segregations.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work sheds light on the development of robust cathodes for IT-SOFCs through rational design of configuration entropy.
Titulo: A medium entropy cathode with enhanced chromium resistance for solid oxide fuel cells
